titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I celebrated at 8 a.m. There were but 16 commts. At Mattins I preached an old sermon which has been published! Knox celebrated; there were 20 cts. Peile lunched with me, and we discussed the vacancy at All Saints. He seems to be partially pledged to go into the diocese of Worcester: and will let me know his final decision within a week.

p.hi: Sir Kenneth Muir Mackenzie brought a party of Wyckhamists
to see the Abbey. I spent an hour & a half with them

body.p: Mr Ambrose Fletcher, a Westminster boy, came to see me to seek advice respecting religious difficulties.
We dined with the Charles Trevelyans. Shaw & his wife were there: and Miss Emmett: & Mr & Mrs Herbert Samuel.
